abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Sector
            Development Project for Ukraine were as follows: the outcome
            was highly unsatisfactory, the sustainability was highly
            unlikely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, the Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and
            the borrower performance as highly unsatisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: Keep the project cycle consistent
            with the opportunity offered by a favorable constituency and
            the project's economic/social relevance in a given
            context. As the economic and political environment changes,
            the Bank needs to adjust fast and effectively, benefiting
            from the flexibility given by operational rules. Building
            ownership for project implementation and project
            sustainability requires broad-based consensus building.
